persons.name: Albert Einstein
persons.description: Elderly man with wild white hair, prominent mustache, deep-set eyes, wearing casual attire
persons.biography: German-born theoretical physicist who developed the theory of relativity. Winner of the 1921 Nobel Prize in Physics. One of the most influential scientists of the 20th century.

quotes.text: Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited. Imagination encircles the world.
The important thing is not to stop questioning. Curiosity has its own reason for existing.

persons.name: Sherlock Holmes
persons.description: Tall, lean man with sharp features, piercing eyes, aquiline nose, wearing a deerstalker cap and Inverness cape
persons.biography: Fictional consulting detective created by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle. Known for his logical reasoning, forensic skills, and deductive methods.

quotes.text: When you have eliminated the impossible, whatever remains, however improbable, must be the truth.
